Class NetworkPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.NetworkPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChatCapabilityServer, Connect4Server

    public class NetworkPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Connect4Server, ChatCapabilityServer

        private int transgressions
        Counter for the transgressions of this player. The player is banned if this value is equal to the TRANSGRESSION_THRESHOLD.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkPlayer

        public NetworkPlayer(int id,
                     java.net.Socket sock,
                     Server server)
        Construct a new NetworkPlayer.
        Parameters:
        id - the id assigned to this player
        sock - the socket on which this player connected to the server
        server - reference to the Server object that creates this player

    • Method Detail

      • newTransgression

        public void newTransgression()
        Increment the transgression counter of this player. If the threshold is reached the player will be banned and the server will no longer listen to this player. If the player is currently in-game the HostedGame object is notified.

      • enroll

        public void enroll(HostedGame newGame)
        Set the game reference of this NetworkPlayer object and of its input handler. In addition, the player's state is updated to in-game.
        Parameters:
        game - the game this player will be enrolled in

      • disenroll

        public void disenroll(HostedGame oldGame)
        Set the game reference of this NetworkPlayer object and of its input handler to null. The player's state is set to IDLE.
        Parameters:
        game - the game from which this player is disenrolled

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • cmdWelcome

        public void cmdWelcome(int assignedUserID,
                       long allowedThinkTime,
                       int capabilities)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Response to a valid HELLO command from a client.
        Specified by:
        cmdWelcome in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        assignedUserID - this is the unique identifier the server assigned to the client who receives this WELCOME command.
        allowedThinkTime - the time the client has to send a valid response to the server in milliseconds. If the client does not respond in time the server will decide what to do next (this depends on the implementing server). Note that the allowed think time can be dependent on whether the client is playing with an AI or as a human, which was reported in the preceding HELLO command.
        capabilities - represents a vector with flags for the capabilities that are implemented in the server. See also the specification for cmdHello(...) in Connect4Client.java.

      • cmdGame

        public void cmdGame(java.lang.String nameOtherPlayer,
                    int otherPlayerID,
                    int playFieldX,
                    int playFieldY,
                    int playFieldZ,
                    int playerWhoHasNextTurnID,
                    int sequenceLengthOfWin)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Signal the client that a new game is started (i.e. an opponent has been found). All game settings including the id and username of the opponent are send along with this.
        Specified by:
        cmdGame in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        nameOtherPlayer - username chosen by the opponent
        otherPlayerID - id assigned to the opponent
        playFieldX - the x dimension of the playing field
        playFieldY - the y dimension of the playing field
        playFieldZ - the z dimension of the playing field, in other words the height
        playerWhoHasNextTurnID - the ID of the player who has the first turn and who should send his move to the server
        sequenceLengthOfWin - the number of chips that make up a winning sequence

      • cmdMoveSuccess

        public void cmdMoveSuccess(int moveX,
                           int moveY,
                           int actorID,
                           int playerWhoHasNextTurnID)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Tell the client that a valid move has been submitted to the server. This could either be the move the receiving client has made himself, but it could also be the move of the opponent.
        Specified by:
        cmdMoveSuccess in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        moveX - the x coordinate where a chip should be placed on top
        moveY - the y coordinate where a chip should be placed on top
        actorID - the ID of the player who made the move
        playerWhoHasNextTurnID - the ID of the player who has the next turn

      • cmdGameEnd

        public void cmdGameEnd(int winnerID)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Tell the client the game has ended and reports the winner or a draw.
        Specified by:
        cmdGameEnd in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        winnerID - the ID of the player who has won. -1 means it's a draw

      • cmdReportIllegal

        public void cmdReportIllegal(java.lang.String theIllegalCommandWithParameters)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Tell the client his last command was either not recognized by the server or was an invalid action.
        Specified by:
        cmdReportIllegal in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        theIllegalCommandWithParameters - The received illegal command along with its parameters

                          java.lang.String reason)
        Description copied from interface: Connect4Server
        Tell the client that a player has left.
        Specified by:
        cmdPlayerLeft in interface Connect4Server
        Parameters:
        leftPlayerID - the ID of the player who has left
        reason - a message generated by the server stating the reason why the player left (e.g. kicked)

      • cmdBroadcastMessage

        public void cmdBroadcastMessage(int senderId,
                                java.lang.String msg)
        Description copied from interface: ChatCapabilityServer
        Sends an user-message to all capable clients, also to the client the MESSAGE command came from.
        Specified by:
        cmdBroadcastMessage in interface ChatCapabilityServer
        Parameters:
        senderId - the id of the user who sent the message
        msg - the message to broadcast

      • sendToClient

        private void sendToClient(java.lang.String cmd,
                          boolean wakeUp)
        Launch a thread that will try to send a command to the client of this player. The command is not sent if the player is banned or an error has occurred earlier.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command to be sent.
        wakeUp - indicate if the HostedGame from where the command was dispatched is waiting and should be woken up

      • sendToClient

        private void sendToClient(java.lang.String cmd,
                          int numsAlreadyTried,
                          boolean wakeUp)
        This method should only be called internally. To send a command use sendToClient(String cmd)

        Send a command to the client. If, for some reason, an error occurs while sending the command, the method is called recursively in order to try and send the command again. After a certain amount of tries it gives up and the player's state is set to ERRORED.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command to send.
        numsAlreadyTried - the amount of tries already made to send the command
        wakeUp - indicate if the HostedGame from where the command was dispatched is waiting and should be woken up
